column4: font/unicode question: some cjk characters aren't showing up, but they seem to be visible on my windows machine.  any idea what i should do?
Which characters? Basically, if *some* font on your system has them, they should appear. Installing the MS Gothic and Mincho fonts tends to be helpful.
0x536A for one
most show up, just a few are missing
Aha, I'm actually missing that one too.
yeah i checked every font installed by default, none of them have it
The *real* helvetica? Probably.
Well, hmm.
It's like one of those things which maybe transcends copyright issues.
I'm just looking to see if I can find a Bitstream Cyberbit ttf. I bet that font has the characters you want.
I used to have it installed, but I don't know what happened to it.
ah, ty
http://ftp.nluug.nl/netscape/communicator/extras/fonts/windows/
Get Cyberbit.ZIP from there, and unpack it into your ~/.fonts
It'll fill in the missing characters :)
do i need to change system fonts?
The system will use it automatically as a fallback.
ty :)

I'm not certain that there aren't other holes which are being plugged by other fonts on my system, but on a quick scroll through the CJK part of unicode in Character Map, I don't see any missing characters now.
I tried install "unifont", that seems to have worked
